solution_line_template: The number of non-valuable files Brennan downloaded in the first round is {first_round_delete_percent}*{first_round_total} = <<{first_round_delete_percent}*{first_round_total}={first_round_non_valuable}>>{first_round_non_valuable} files.

The number of valuable files Brennan downloaded in the first round is {first_round_total}-{first_round_non_valuable} = <<{first_round_total}-{first_round_non_valuable}={first_round_valuable}>>{first_round_valuable}

When he downloaded {second_round_total} new files, there were {second_round_delete_fraction}*{second_round_total}= <<{second_round_delete_fraction}*{second_round_total}={second_round_non_valuable}>>{second_round_non_valuable} non-useful files, which he deleted again.

The total number of valuable files he downloaded in the second round is {second_round_total}-{second_round_non_valuable} = <<{second_round_total}-{second_round_non_valuable}={second_round_valuable}>>{second_round_valuable}

To write his research, Brennan had {second_round_valuable}+{first_round_valuable} = <<{second_round_valuable}+{first_round_valuable}={total_valuable}>>{total_valuable} useful files to reference to write his research.
